message:
Hello,

We're planning a move to London next year and are considering Bassett House for our son, who's currently in Year 2. We’re looking for a school that provides both strong academic challenge and a nurturing environment, as he's bright but quite sensitive.

Could you tell us more about how you support children who need stretching academically, while also ensuring they feel emotionally secure? We're also curious about music opportunities — he plays the violin — and whether you offer any taster sessions or trial days before enrolling.

Thank you in advance.
Kind regards,  
Mrs Eliza Hartley
reply: Subject: Welcome to Bassett House School Dear Mrs Hartley, Thank you for reaching out and considering Bassett House School for your son. I understand your desire for a school that offers both strong academic challenge and a nurturing environment, especially for a bright but sensitive child. At Bassett House, we pride ourselves on being a school with a big heart. Our teachers are dedicated to knowing each pupil well, recognising not only their strengths but also their quirks and potential. We believe that academic excellence and kindness can go hand in hand. Our curriculum is designed to be both challenging and engaging, ensuring that children are stretched academically while feeling emotionally secure. We are particularly mindful of the needs of sensitive children and provide a supportive pastoral environment. Our smaller school setting allows us to foster genuine relationships, helping children feel at home and secure. We encourage all pupils to ‘Be the best you can be’, and this ethos permeates everything we do. Regarding music opportunities, we are delighted to offer a range of musical programmes, including violin lessons. We recognise the importance of nurturing artistic talents alongside academic pursuits, and our music department is vibrant and supportive. We would love to invite you and your son to experience Bassett House firsthand. We offer taster sessions and trial days, which provide a wonderful opportunity for prospective pupils to engage with our school community. Additionally, I would be more than happy to arrange a tour of the school or a meeting to discuss your son’s specific needs in greater detail. Please feel free to reach out to me directly to arrange a visit or if you have any further questions. Warm regards, Jess Ottley-Woodd Director of Admissions Bassett House School

Dear Parent, Thank you for your interest in Bassett House School. We are delighted to welcome prospective families to our school and would be pleased to provide you with more information about our upcoming events. We invite you to visit our Open Events page for the most current details regarding our open days. These events are a wonderful opportunity to explore our school environment, meet our dedicated staff, and learn more about the enriching educational experience we offer. Additionally, you can learn more about our school by visiting our About Us page. For families with young children, we also offer Stay & Play sessions specifically for prospective Nursery and Reception families. During these sessions, you will have the chance to meet our Early Years team, connect with other parents, and enjoy a coffee, all while your child explores our bespoke play and learning space. Please note that your child must be formally registered with us to attend a Stay & Play session. You can find more information and register your child on our Stay & Play page. Should you have any further questions or require additional information, please do not hesitate to reach out. We are here to assist you in any way we can. You can find our contact details on our Contact Us page. Warm regards, Jess Ottley-Woodd Director of Admissions Bassett House School
